disease: Malignant neoplasm of short bones of left upper limb

symptoms.name: Pain
symptoms.pattern: May be present or absent; can range from mild to severe

symptoms.name: Bone fracture
symptoms.pattern: Can occur due to weakened bone structure

symptoms.name: General malaise
symptoms.pattern: Can range from mild weakness to significant illness, depending on cancer progression

physical_findings: Palpable mass or swelling in the affected bone

imaging_findings.X-ray: Lytic lesions, bone destruction, periosteal reaction
imaging_findings.CT scan: Detailed visualization of bone involvement, assessment of extent of disease
imaging_findings.MRI: Evaluation of soft tissue involvement, assessment of tumor margins

required: Imaging evidence of a malignant neoplasm in the short bones of the left upper limb (e.g., lytic lesions, bone destruction)
supportive: Clinical symptoms and physical findings consistent with bone cancer
